abstract: United Nations reports at least 6,417 people have been killed and 16,000 injured since start of conflict in eastern Ukraine; says both Ukrainian forces and pro-Russian separatists continue to commit abuses that could be considered war crimes.
lead_paragraph: Over 6,400 have been killed and 16,000 injured since fighting broke out between Ukraine and pro-Russian separatists in 2014.

headline.main: Fighting in Ukraine Eases, but Abuses Continue on Both Sides, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Ukraine: Nearly 6,500 Have Died in Conflict, United Nations Says

snippet: Over 6,400 have been killed and 16,000 injured since fighting broke out between Ukraine and pro-Russian separatists in 2014.
